title.rendered: Jordon Briggs: Net Worth 2023, Career Earnings

content.rendered:
Summary

  • About Jordon Briggs
    • Early Life
    • Professional Career
  • Jordon Briggs’s Net Worth in 2023
    • Career Earnings
    • Endorsements
  • Personal Details
    • Husband
    • How Old is Jordon Briggs?
    • What is her nationality?
    • Career Highlights
    • FAQs About Jordon Briggs

Jordon Briggs is a professional barrel racer and rodeo contestant who has made a name for herself in the world of rodeo. She is a 4-time WPRA World Champion and has earned over $1 million in her career.

Born in Elbert, Colorado, Jordon is the daughter of four-time WPRA World Champion and ProRodeo Hall of Fame inductee Kristie Peterson.

Here you can follow Jordon Briggs’ net worth, career earnings, career earnings, husband, and more.

About Jordon Briggs

Jordon Briggs was born on August 9, 1988, in Elbert, Colorado. She grew up in a rodeo family, with her mother being a successful barrel racer.

Jordon started running barrels before she was 8 years old and began competing in junior rodeos when she was around 10 years old.

In March 2009, Jordon married Justin Briggs, a former team roper at Tarleton State in Stephenville, Texas. The couple has a daughter named Bexley.

Early Life

Jordon’s early life revolved around rodeo, as she traveled with her mother to various competitions. Her first real barrel horse was a half-pony named Apple Jacks, which she got when she was around 8 or 9 years old.

Jordon’s passion for barrel racing grew as she continued to compete and train with various horses throughout her childhood and teenage years.

Professional Career

Jordon Briggs has had a successful professional career as a barrel racer, with numerous wins and accolades to her name. Some of her career highlights include winning the 2021 World Champion and NFR Avg. Champion titles, as well as being a 2-time Barrel Futurities of America World Champion.

In 2022, she finished as the Reserve World Champion. Jordon has also earned over $1 million in her career.

Jordon Briggs’s Net Worth in 2023

As of 2023, Jordon Briggs’s estimated net worth is $3 million. Her net worth is primarily derived from her winnings in various competitions and endorsements.

Career Earnings

Jordon Briggs has had a successful career in barrel racing and rodeo, with significant earnings to her name. Her lifetime earnings exceed $1 million.

In the 2023 regular season, she earned $160,824.

In 2022, she finished the year as the reserve world champion with earnings of $274,520. This included $96,741 that she won at the National Finals Rodeo (NFR).

In 2021, she won her first WPRA World Barrel Racing title and finished the year with earnings of $297,460. This included $69,234 that she won at the NFR.

In addition to her earnings from competitions, Briggs also earns income from endorsements and her work as a trainer at Briggs Performance Horses.

Endorsements

Jordon Briggs is a Team Durango ambassador and has endorsed Durango boots, praising their comfort and lightweight design.

Personal Details

Husband

Jordon Briggs is married to Justin Briggs, a former team roper at Tarleton State in Stephenville, Texas.

They got married in 2010 and settled in Tolar, Texas, in 2021. Their business, Briggs Performance Horses, focuses mainly on producing top barrel horses, barrel horse prospects, and rope horses.

How Old is Jordon Briggs?

Jordon Briggs is 35 years old, and she was born on August 9, 1988.

What is her nationality?

She is American.

FAQs About Jordon Briggs

What is Jordon Briggs’ Net Worth?

Her estimated net worth is $3 million.

When did she start barrel racing?

Jordon started running barrels before she was 8 years old and began competing in junior rodeos when she was around 10 years old.

Who is her husband?

Justin Briggs.
